caption: Fra Angelico's Annunciation (mid-1430s)
description: Fra Angelico's exquisite depiction of the Archangel Gabriel announcing to Mary that she will bear the Son of God, featuring delicate colors and heavenly light.
subject: The Annunciation to the Virgin Mary
title: Annunciation

caption: Rembrandt's The Visitation
description: Rembrandt's dramatic depiction of the meeting between Mary and Elizabeth, emphasizing spiritual connection through masterful use of light and shadow.
subject: Mary visiting her cousin Elizabeth
title: The Visitation

caption: Giovanni Antonio Pellegrini's The Nativity
description: Pellegrini's elegant fresco depicting the birth of Jesus with graceful figures and soft colors typical of the Rococo style.
subject: Birth of Jesus Christ
title: The Nativity

caption: Fresco of Presentation in the Temple in Chiesa di Santa Rita by Giulio Campi (1547)
description: Giulio Campi's Mannerist fresco depicting the ritual presentation of the infant Jesus to Simeon in the Jerusalem Temple.
mystery_name: The Presentation of Jesus in the Temple
subject: Presentation of Jesus in the Temple
title: Presentation in the Temple

caption: Finding of Jesus in the Temple mosaic from Lourdes Basilica, France
description: Byzantine-style mosaic depicting the twelve-year-old Jesus discussing scripture with Jewish teachers in the Temple of Jerusalem.
mystery_name: The Finding of Jesus in the Temple
subject: Jesus among the teachers in the Temple
title: Finding of Jesus in the Temple

caption: An unknown artist's fresco, Baptism of Christ, in Padua's church of San Benedetto
description: Medieval fresco depicting John the Baptist baptizing Jesus in the Jordan River with the Holy Spirit descending as a dove.
location: Church of San Benedetto Vecchio, Padua
mystery_name: The Baptism of Jesus in the Jordan
subject: Baptism of Jesus by John the Baptist
title: Baptism of Christ

caption: Carl Bloch's The Wedding at Cana
description: Carl Bloch's dramatic depiction of Jesus performing his first miracle by transforming water into wine at a wedding feast.
subject: Jesus turning water into wine
title: The Wedding at Cana

caption: James Tissot's Healing of the Lepers at Capernaum
description: Tissot's detailed illustration of Jesus healing lepers, capturing the moment of miraculous healing and the crowd's reaction.
mystery_name: The Proclamation of the Kingdom of God
subject: Jesus healing lepers
title: Healing of the Lepers at Capernaum

caption: Transfiguration in Vienna's Votive Church
description: Neo-Gothic stained glass window depicting Jesus transfigured in divine light before Peter, James, and John on Mount Tabor.
subject: Transfiguration of Jesus
title: Transfiguration

caption: Giacomo Raffaelli (1753-1836) , an Italian mosaicist, created a life-sized mosaic copy of Leonardo da Vinci's The Last Supper
description: Raffaelli's meticulous mosaic reproduction of Leonardo's masterpiece, depicting Jesus instituting the Eucharist at the Last Supper.
subject: The Last Supper and Institution of the Eucharist
title: The Last Supper

caption: Agony in the Garden by Vicente Masip, also known as Vicente Juan Masip
description: Jesus prays in anguish at Gethsemane while apostles sleep, accepting God's will before his arrest.
subject: Christ praying in Gethsemane during his agony
title: Agony in the Garden

caption: Giovanni Antonio Bazzi known as Sodoma, Christ at the Column (c. 1510-1515; detached fresco, 140 x 101 cm; Siena, Pinacoteca Nazionale)
description: Jesus bound to a column receives brutal scourging, suffering for humanity's redemption.
subject: Christ being scourged at the pillar before his crucifixion
title: Christ at the Column

caption: Titian’s Christ Crowned with Thorns (c. 1542–1543)
description: Jesus endures the cruel crowning with thorns while being mocked by soldiers.
subject: Roman soldiers mockingly crown Jesus with thorns as King of the Jews
title: Christ Crowned with Thorns

caption: Pieter Bruegel the Elder’s The Procession to Calvary (1564)
description: Jesus struggles under the cross's weight while crowds follow him to crucifixion.
subject: Christ carrying the cross through a crowded landscape toward Golgotha
title: The Procession to Calvary

caption: The fresco of Crucifixion in the church San Girolamo dei Croati by Pietro Gagliardi (1847-1852)
description: Jesus dies on the cross between two thieves, completing his redemptive sacrifice.
location: Chiesa di San Girolamo dei Croati, Rome, Italy
subject: Christ's sacrificial death on the cross at Golgotha
title: Crucifixion

caption: Resurrection (1593) by Annibale Carracci
description: Jesus rises gloriously from the dead, conquering death and sin for humanity.
subject: Christ triumphantly rising from the tomb on Easter morning
title: Resurrection

caption: Crossing (Ascension) cupola 1175-1200 Mosaic Basilica di San Marco (Cupola of St. Mark), Venice
description: Jesus ascends to heaven while apostles watch, promising the Holy Spirit's coming.
location: Basilica di San Marco, Venice, Italy
subject: Christ ascending into heaven forty days after resurrection
title: Ascension Cupola

caption: “Pentecost” by Jean Restout II (1692–1768)
description: Holy Spirit descends as tongues of fire, empowering apostles for mission.
mystery_name: The Descent of the Holy Spirit
subject: Holy Spirit descending upon Mary and apostles at Pentecost
title: Pentecost

caption: The Assumption of Virgin Mary in the main cupola in Chiesa di Santa Maria del Orto by Giuseppe and Andrea Orazi 1706
description: Mary is assumed body and soul into heavenly glory by angels.
location: Chiesa di Santa Maria del Orto, Rome, Italy
subject: Virgin Mary's bodily assumption into heaven at end of earthly life
title: Assumption of the Virgin Mary

caption: Coronation of the Virgin, a painting on oil on canvas by Diego Velázquez of the Holy Trinity crowning the Blessed Virgin Mary, at the Museo del Prado
description: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit crown Mary as heavenly queen for eternity.
subject: Holy Trinity crowning Mary as Queen of Heaven and Earth
title: Coronation of the Virgin

caption: The Annunciation, an 1898 painting by African-American painter Henry Ossawa Tanner
description: A groundbreaking depiction showing Mary as an ordinary young woman visited by a column of golden light representing Gabriel.
subject: The Annunciation to the Virgin Mary
title: The Annunciation

caption: The painting of Visitation in the church Chiesa dei Santi Severino e Sossio by Federico Maldarelli (1889)
description: Depicts the meeting between Virgin Mary and her cousin Elizabeth, both miraculously pregnant with Jesus and John the Baptist.
location: Chiesa dei Santi Severino e Sossio, Naples, Italy
subject: The Visitation of Mary to Elizabeth
title: The Visitation

caption: Gerard van Honthorst - Adoration of the Shepherds (1622)
description: Caravaggesque night scene with dramatic chiaroscuro showing shepherds witnessing the newborn Christ child.
subject: The Nativity scene with shepherds adoring Christ
title: Adoration of the Shepherds

caption: The painting of Presentation of Jesus in the Temple in church kostel Svatého Havla by unknown baroque artist
description: Baroque depiction of Mary and Joseph presenting the infant Jesus to Simeon in the Jerusalem Temple.
location: Church of St. Gall (kostel Svatého Havla), Prague, Czech Republic
mystery_name: The Presentation of Jesus in the Temple
subject: Presentation of infant Jesus at the Temple
title: Presentation of Jesus in the Temple

caption: Jesus, at 12, teaching in the Temple
description: Depicts the youthful Jesus astonishing Temple scholars with his wisdom after being found by his parents.
mystery_name: The Finding of Jesus in the Temple
subject: Twelve-year-old Jesus teaching in the Temple
title: Christ Among the Doctors

artist: Andrea del Verrocchio and Leonardo da Vinci
caption: The Baptism of Christ by Leonardo Da Vinci created in the studio of Andrea del Verrochio around 1475
description: Collaborative work showing Jesus' baptism with divine revelation and Leonardo's angel foreshadowing his genius.
mystery_name: The Baptism of Jesus in the Jordan
subject: Baptism of Jesus by John the Baptist
title: The Baptism of Christ

caption: Gerard David's The Marriage at Cana
description: Detailed Netherlandish depiction of Jesus performing his first miracle at the wedding feast in Cana.
subject: Christ's first miracle turning water into wine
title: The Marriage at Cana

caption: The Adulterous Woman by Lorenzo Lotto
description: Powerful scene showing Jesus' mercy and wisdom in preventing the stoning of a condemned woman.
mystery_name: The Proclamation of the Kingdom of God
subject: Jesus saving the adulterous woman from stoning
title: Christ and the Adulteress

caption: Raphael's The Transfiguration
description: Raphael's masterpiece combining Christ's divine transfiguration above with human suffering and healing below.
subject: Christ's transfiguration and healing of possessed boy
title: The Transfiguration

caption: The Last Supper by Juan de Juanes
description: Spanish Renaissance depiction of Christ instituting the Eucharist with apostles in solemn communion.
subject: Institution of the Eucharist at the Last Supper
title: The Last Supper

caption: The Prayer of Jesus in Gethsemane by Alessandro Maganza
description: Jesus kneels in prayer at Gethsemane while apostles sleep, capturing his spiritual anguish before crucifixion. Dramatic lighting emphasizes divine acceptance.
subject: Agony in the Garden of Gethsemane
title: The Prayer of Jesus in Gethsemane

caption: The Flagellation of Christ: Painting by Caravaggio
description: Christ is bound to a column while Roman soldiers brutally whip him. Caravaggio's chiaroscuro intensifies the physical suffering and redemptive sacrifice.
location: Musée des Beaux-Arts de Rouen, France
subject: Flagellation of Christ at the pillar
title: The Flagellation of Christ

caption: Caravaggio's Ecce Homo - Behold The Man
description: Pontius Pilate presents the scourged Christ crowned with thorns to the crowd. Intimate composition emphasizes human vulnerability and divine dignity.
subject: Pilate presenting Christ crowned with thorns
title: Ecce Homo

caption: The Lost Caravaggio - Ecce Homo
description: Recently rediscovered work showing Christ with crown of thorns and reed scepter. Controversial attribution showcases Caravaggio's dramatic realism.
subject: Christ presented to the people after crowning with thorns
title: Ecce Homo

caption: Christ carrying the Cross (1605) by Orazio Gentileschi
description: Christ struggles under the weight of the cross on the road to Golgotha. Gentileschi's emotional realism conveys profound human suffering and sacrifice.
subject: Via Dolorosa - Christ carrying cross to Calvary
title: Christ Carrying the Cross

caption: James Tissot's What Our Lord Saw From The Cross
description: Unique viewpoint showing the crowd from Christ's perspective on the cross. Tissot's archaeological accuracy combines with profound theological insight.
original_title: Ce que voyait Notre-Seigneur sur la Croix
subject: Crucifixion scene from Christ's perspective
title: What Our Lord Saw from the Cross

caption: Caravaggio's The Incredulity of St. Thomas
description: Thomas probes Christ's wound while other apostles watch. Caravaggio's dramatic lighting emphasizes physical proof of resurrection and faith.
subject: Thomas touching Christ's resurrection wounds
title: The Incredulity of Saint Thomas

caption: Ascension of the Lord by Bernardino Gandino
description: Christ rises to heaven while apostles watch in wonder below. Gandino's composition emphasizes divine glory and the promise of eternal life.
location: Church of Santa Maria Maggiore, Bergamo, Italy
subject: Christ ascending to heaven
title: Ascension of the Lord

caption: Pentecost by Titian
description: Holy Spirit descends as fiery tongues upon Mary and apostles. Titian's vibrant colors and dynamic composition convey divine inspiration and grace.
location: Santa Maria della Salute, Venice, Italy
mystery_name: The Descent of the Holy Spirit
subject: Descent of Holy Spirit upon apostles
title: Pentecost

caption: Fresco of Assumption of Our Lady in the Vision of St Bonaventure in the church Chiesa di Santa Lucia del Gonfalone by Cesare Mariani (1863)
description: Mary ascends to heaven surrounded by angels while St. Bonaventure witnesses the vision. Mariani's fresco combines mystical vision with classical composition.
location: Chiesa di Santa Lucia del Gonfalone, Rome, Italy
subject: Assumption of Mary into heaven
title: Assumption of the Virgin with Vision of St. Bonaventure

caption: Coronation of the Virgin, fresco by Giuseppe Mattia Borgnis
description: Baroque fresco depicting the Virgin Mary being crowned by the Holy Trinity as Queen of Heaven, symbolizing her glorious assumption and heavenly reward.
subject: Coronation of Mary as Queen of Heaven
title: Coronation of the Virgin

caption: Jan van Eyck's The Annunciation portrays the angel Gabriel announcing to Mary, who humbly accepts God's will
description: Northern Renaissance masterpiece showing Archangel Gabriel announcing to Mary that she will bear the Son of God, with exquisite detail and symbolism.
location: National Gallery of Art, Washington D.C.
subject: Annunciation to the Virgin Mary
title: The Annunciation

caption: Basilica of the Visitation in Ein Karem, a village in the hill country of Judea where John the Baptist was born
description: Depiction of Mary's visit to her cousin Elizabeth, both pregnant with Jesus and John the Baptist, showing their joyful meeting and mutual recognition.
location: Basilica of the Visitation, Ein Karem
subject: Mary visiting Elizabeth
title: The Visitation

caption: Nativity with St. Francis and St. Lawrence by Caravaggio
description: Caravaggio's dramatic Baroque nativity scene showing the newborn Christ with Mary, Joseph, and saints Francis and Lawrence in humble adoration.
original_title: Natività con i Santi Francesco e Lorenzo
subject: Nativity of Jesus with saints
title: Nativity with St. Francis and St. Lawrence

caption: Simeon's Song of Praise by Arent de Gelder
description: Dutch Golden Age painting depicting the elderly Simeon recognizing the infant Jesus as the Messiah during the presentation in the temple.
mystery_name: The Presentation of Jesus in the Temple
subject: Presentation of Jesus in the Temple
title: Simeon's Song of Praise

caption: Finding of the Savior in the Temple by William Holman Hunt
description: Pre-Raphaelite masterpiece showing the adolescent Jesus discussing theology with rabbis in the temple, as his worried parents search for him.
mystery_name: The Finding of Jesus in the Temple
original_title: The Finding of the Saviour in the Temple
subject: Finding of Jesus in the Temple
title: The Finding of the Saviour in the Temple

caption: Apparition of the Messiah, an oil painting on canvas, measuring 540 cm × 750 cm, by Russian painter Alexander Andreyevich Ivanov (1806–1858)
description: Monumental Russian Romantic painting showing John the Baptist pointing to the approaching Christ, with diverse reactions from the crowd awaiting redemption.
mystery_name: The Proclamation of the Kingdom of God
subject: First appearance of Christ to the people
title: The Appearance of Christ Before the People

caption: Wedding at Cana by Paolo Veronese
description: Massive Venetian Renaissance banquet scene depicting Christ's first miracle of turning water into wine at the wedding feast in Cana.
subject: Wedding at Cana miracle
title: The Wedding at Cana

caption: Christ in the Storm on the Sea of Galilee, a 1633 oil-on-canvas painting by the Dutch Golden Age painter Rembrandt van Rijn
description: Rembrandt's only seascape showing Jesus miraculously calming the stormy sea while the terrified disciples struggle with their fishing boat.
mystery_name: The Proclamation of the Kingdom of God
original_title: De storm op het meer van Galilea
subject: Christ calming the storm
title: The Storm on the Sea of Galilee

caption: The Savior's Transfiguration by Theophanes the Greek
description: Byzantine icon showing Christ transfigured in divine light on Mount Tabor, with Moses and Elijah appearing beside him as witnesses.
subject: Transfiguration of Christ
title: The Transfiguration

caption: Christ and the Disciples Before the Last Supper by Henry Ossawa Tanner
description: Tanner's intimate portrayal of Christ preparing with disciples before the Last Supper, blending realism with spiritual symbolism and warm lighting.
subject: Last Supper preparation
title: Christ and the Disciples Before the Last Supper

caption: The Arrest of Christ Kiss of Judas by Giotto
description: Giotto's revolutionary fresco capturing the dramatic moment of Judas' betrayal through expressive figures and emotional intensity in the Garden of Gethsemane.
subject: Betrayal and arrest of Christ
title: The Kiss of Judas

caption: The Flagellation of Our Lord Jesus Christ by Bouguereau
description: Bouguereau's masterful academic depiction of Christ's flagellation, showcasing perfect anatomy, divine suffering, and symbolic sacrificial beauty.
subject: Scourging of Christ
title: The Flagellation of Our Lord Jesus Christ

caption: Van Dyck's _The Crowning with Thorns_ (early 17th century), a Baroque depiction of Christ's suffering and paradoxical triumph
description: Van Dyck's Baroque masterpiece showing Christ's silent dignity amid torment, with dramatic lighting emphasizing his spiritual triumph through suffering.
subject: Mocking and crowning of Christ
title: The Crowning with Thorns

caption: Raphael's Christ Falls on the Way to Calvary, a painting depicting Christ stumbling under the cross with Mary and a crowd witnessing
description: Raphael's High Renaissance composition showing Christ's third fall, with perfect balance, emotional depth, and Virgin Mary's compassionate presence.
subject: Christ carrying the cross
title: Christ Falls on the Way to Calvary

caption: The Descent from the Cross (1616-1617) by Rubens: A dynamic, dramatic depiction of Christ's descent
description: Rubens' Baroque masterpiece depicting the dramatic descent of Christ's body with muscular figures, diagonal composition, and emotional intensity.
subject: Deposition of Christ
title: The Descent from the Cross

caption: The Three Marys at the Tomb by Annibale Carracci, 17th century at Hermitage Museum, reveals Baroque vividness and drama
description: Carracci's Baroque depiction of the three Marys discovering the empty tomb, with dramatic lighting and emotional astonishment at the Resurrection.
subject: Resurrection discovery
title: Holy Women at Christ's Tomb

caption: Christ Taking Leave of the Apostles by Duccio, 14th century, Museo dell'Opera, tempera on wood, Gothic details
description: Duccio's Gothic panel showing Christ's post-resurrection appearance, commissioning apostles with golden background and elegant Sienese linear style.
subject: Christ's commissioning of apostles
title: Appearance on the Mountain in Galilee

caption: Simone Peterzano's Pentecost depicts the Virgin and disciples receiving the Holy Spirit in Mannerist style
description: Peterzano's Mannerist interpretation of Pentecost with elongated figures, Virgin Mary central, and dramatic spiritual energy descending upon apostles.
mystery_name: The Descent of the Holy Spirit
subject: Descent of Holy Spirit
title: Pentecost

caption: The Divine Exchange Between Mother and Son
description: Gothic stained glass depicting Mary's Assumption into heaven, surrounded by angels with radiant colors and divine light symbolism.
subject: Assumption of Mary
title: Assumption of Mary Stained Glass Window

caption: Mary, Help of Christians by Giuseppe Rollini
description: Fresco depicting the Virgin Mary crowned as Queen of Heaven with infant Jesus, representing her role as protector and helper of all Christians.
subject: Virgin Mary crowned as Queen of Heaven with Christ Child
title: Mary, Help of Christians
